Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
FOR CWL ONLY

contract.

questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 860-0787.

ALLEGATION:
The agency has not submitted records to the Michigan Department of Health and
Human Services (MDHHS) for permanent retention one year following the final order
of adoption as required. There are five records that have not been submitted.
INVESTIGATION:
On 5/22/2022 I reviewed the complaint, and contact was made with the complainant
via email by my Peer Consultant on 5/23/2022. I made initial contact with the
agency about the complaint via email on 5/24/2022.
On 5/25/2022, Adoption Departmental Manager (ADM) X provided information about
the complaint to me, and a Peer Consultant, via email. ADM X reported her
department had been in contact with agencies about their closed adoption records.
The department had inquired with the agencies as to the status of the closed
adoption files requested. Her department found that these files either had not been
submitted to the local office at all or were submitted outside the required timeframe
of 12 to 13 months following finalization. ADM X listed six finalized adoption files for
Orchard Children’s Services that may not have been submitted.
ADM X provided clarity on how the files are to be closed and sent to the County
Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS) office, and the DHS-788 form to
be attached on the closed file boxes. Additionally, ADM X provided information with
respect to if an agency still has old closed adoption records outside the ones on the
list provided related to the complaint; and what that agency should do with those
records. Whether those closed records should come to ADM X’s office or the
County DHHS Office. ADM X reported, when R400.12713 was updated in 2015,
agencies were instructed to send their backlogged adoption records directly to
Central Office. She reported, it has been seven years and at this point agencies
should be caught up, and on schedule to send closed records to the local offices
between 12-13 months following finalization. If an agency still has old closed
adoption records, her office will work with the agency, accept those old records, to
not have the local county office bombarded with old records. She advised it would be
very helpful if the agency would include in any corrective action plan the agency’s
plan to ensure that Lansing/the department gets those old records.
On 5/24/2022 via telephone, I spoke with Director/Administrator 1 and Director 2.
Director 2 was interviewed further by me during an onsite agency visit on 6/9/2022.
The two directors reported having several closed adoption files which have not been
sent to the County Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS) offices. They
reported being aware that the closed records are to go the local DHHS Office, who
will combine the adoption record with the child’s foster care record and sent it to
3

Lansing. The directors expressed that there have been problems with the closed
adoption file submission process, due to different county offices giving different
directions as to how they want the file contents sorted and the record submitted.
They also advised of some DHHS offices not accepting the files or rejecting their
closed records. They reported sending 40 boxes (for 10-20 children) of closed
adoption records to DHHS- Western Wayne three months ago, only to have those
records returned to them about one month ago, for the reasons related to how the
record was filed.
Director/Administrator 1 and Director 2 acknowledged receiving a list of closed
adoption records that ADM X’s office inquired about. The directors reported that list
did not include all siblings. They noted the latter, because their practice has been to
wait until the last child had been adopted before forwarding the closed record. They
reported having more than the six closed adoption files named in the complaint for
which finalization has occurred, and that they are processing to submit to DHHS.
They reported having been in touch with four relevant DHHS county offices (North
Central, South Central, Macomb, Livingston) and they were waiting to hear back
from these county offices related to the submission and drop off or closed records.
Director 2 reported the agency received an email, not a letter from the MDHHS
Adoption Closed Record Unit in late April 2022 asking for the status of the six closed
adoption cases. The email requested a respond by 4/27/2022. Director 2 reported
contact was made with ADM X and State Adoption Analyst (SAA)T after that email.
She advised ADM X’s office the agency had reached out to the local DHHS offices
for guidance on submitting the closed records. Also, that the agency had delivered
Child A’s closed adoption record to Livingston County DHHS on 4/29/2022. At that
time, she did not inform ADM X or (SAA)T as to when Child B’s, Child C’s, Child D’s,
Child E’s or Child F’s closed records would be submitted, because she did not know
when the specific county office could accept them. On 6/9/2022, Director 2 reported
Child B’s, and Child C’s closed adoption records had been submitted. Director 2
provided submission verification of that by way of “Foster Care/Adoption File
Transfer” receipt forms. The forms showed Child A’s (adoption finalized 10/22/2020)
closed adoption record was submitted (to Livingston County DHHS) on 4/28/2022.
Child B’s and Child C’s (adoptions finalized 10/22/2022) closed adoption records
were submitted (to Macomb County DHHS) on 4/29/2022. Child D’s, and Child E’s
(adoptions finalized 11/6/2020) closed adoption records, as well as three others
closed records were submitted (to DHHS- North Central) on 5/24/2022. Submission
of Child F’s closed adoption record was still pending.
Director 2 also reported having 14 boxes of closed adoption record to submit to
DHHS-Western Wayne, but this county office, will not take closed cases until the
end of this month. The agency also had three boxes of closed cases to submit to St.
Clair County DHHS: and seven for DHHS-South Central. Additionally, they have 50
finalized adoption cases for 2018, which they must sort/compile and submit to
DHHS. They plan to have these all completed/submitted within the next six months.
4

During my on-site visit on 6/9/2022, I observed the agency’s secure closed file
adoption storage room. Director 2 reported the agency’s plan for staying rule
compliant going forward is that the agency will utilize the month of June as their
reflection and submission month. Their managers and clerical unit will run the
number of adoptions finalized within the last 12 months. They will compile the
number of boxes that need to go out and will contact each county DHHS office to
schedule the drop offs. They will record the submissions with their Foster
Care/Adoption File Transfer form.
Reviewed

since the child’s adoption finalization date. A status update was requested by
4/27/2022.
 A copy of the Foster Care/Adoption File Transfer receipt forms for adoption
records referenced earlier in this report.
 Copies of emails from the agency to DHHS- Western Wayne on 5/27/2022,
6/1/2022; and response back from this county office to the agency, related to
dropping off 14 boxes of files.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12713 Adoption placement record.
(5) The Michigan department of human services must
permanently retain all adoption records for children
adopted from Michigan's child welfare system. The
adoption agency must forward any adoption records for
children adopted from the Michigan child welfare system to
the department one year after finalization of the adoption.
The adoption agency may not retain the original copies or
any other copies of the adoption records.
5

ANALYSIS: The agency did not submit Child A’s Child B’s, Child C’s, Child
D’s, Child E’s or Child F’s finalized adoption record timely per
the rule. Child A’s adoption was finalized on 10/22/2020 and the
closed adoption record was submitted on 4/28/2022. Child B’s,
Child C’s and Child D’s adoptions were also finalized on
10/22/2020; and their closed adoption records were submitted
on 4/29/2022. Child D’s and Child E’s adoptions were finalized
on 11/6/2020 and their closed record submission occurred on
5/24/2022. Child F’s adoption was finalized on 10/28/2020, and
the closed adoption record submission is pending. Additionally,
the agency admitted to having 50 other closed adoption cases
for children whose adoptions were finalized in 2018 whose
closed adoption record submission is pending.
The agency is in violation of the rule.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, continuation of the agency’s
current licensing status is recommended.
